config.task_str:
I have prepared two data tables in the Notion `Oil Price` page. Please fetch WTI and Brent monthly prices for the last 12 months from Yahoo Finance, analyze the WTI-Brent oil spread changes and calculate related indicators, implement a z-score-based spread trading strategy backtest, and return a summary report.

For detailed technical specifications, please refer to the `detail.md` file.

system_prompts.agent:
Accessible workspace directory: /workspace/dumps/workspace
When processing tasks, if you need to read/write local files and the user provides a relative path, you need to combine it with the above workspace directory to get the complete path.
If you believe the task is completed, you can either call the `local-claim_done` tool or respond without calling any tool to indicate completion. This will immediately terminate the task, and you will have no further opportunity to work on it.
Please complete the given task independently. Do not seek confirmation or additional feedback from the user. You should handle all situations on your own, as the user will not provide any further information.
system_prompts.user:
你是一位正在与 AI 助手对话的真实用户，请按以下最小提示进行：

## 你的任务目标
- 让 agent 用 Yahoo Finance 获取 WTI/Brent 最近 12 个已结束自然月（月频）数据，在 Notion 页面内已有的三张真实表格中写入“价差分析（Oil Market Summary）”与“回测结果（Spread Strategy Backtest）”，并返回单行标准结果。

## 分阶段沟通
1. 先问：最近油价和两者价差的情况。
2. 然后说：需要最近 12 个月（UTC）的价差、z-score 和基于阈值的信号。
3. 最后补充：做 1 个月持有期的均值回归回测（含总成本 0.40%），把结果写入页面里的对应两张表，并给出单行标准结果。

## 风格
- 每次 1-2 句，口语化，不要一次性给全量需求。

## 终止
- 当对方完成 Notion 写入并返回单行结果后，回复：#### STOP

function.name: filesystem-read_file
function.description: Read the complete contents of a file from the file system. Handles various text encodings and provides detailed error messages if the file cannot be read. Use this tool when you need to examine the contents of a single file. Use the 'head' parameter to read only the first N lines of a file, or the 'tail' parameter to read only the last N lines of a file. Only works within allowed directories.

tail.description: If provided, returns only the last N lines of the file

head.description: If provided, returns only the first N lines of the file

function.name: filesystem-read_multiple_files
function.description: Read the contents of multiple files simultaneously. This is more efficient than reading files one by one when you need to analyze or compare multiple files. Each file's content is returned with its path as a reference. Failed reads for individual files won't stop the entire operation. Only works within allowed directories.

function.name: filesystem-write_file
function.description: Create a new file or completely overwrite an existing file with new content. Use with caution as it will overwrite existing files without warning. Handles text content with proper encoding. Only works within allowed directories.

function.name: filesystem-edit_file
function.description: Make line-based edits to a text file. Each edit replaces exact line sequences with new content. Returns a git-style diff showing the changes made. Only works within allowed directories.

oldText.description: Text to search for - must match exactly

dryRun.description: Preview changes using git-style diff format

function.name: filesystem-create_directory
function.description: Create a new directory or ensure a directory exists. Can create multiple nested directories in one operation. If the directory already exists, this operation will succeed silently. Perfect for setting up directory structures for projects or ensuring required paths exist. Only works within allowed directories.

function.name: filesystem-list_directory
function.description: Get a detailed listing of all files and directories in a specified path. Results clearly distinguish between files and directories with [FILE] and [DIR] prefixes. This tool is essential for understanding directory structure and finding specific files within a directory. Only works within allowed directories.

function.name: filesystem-list_directory_with_sizes
function.description: Get a detailed listing of all files and directories in a specified path, including sizes. Results clearly distinguish between files and directories with [FILE] and [DIR] prefixes. This tool is useful for understanding directory structure and finding specific files within a directory. Only works within allowed directories.

sortBy.description: Sort entries by name or size

function.name: filesystem-directory_tree
function.description: Get a recursive tree view of files and directories as a JSON structure. Each entry includes 'name', 'type' (file/directory), and 'children' for directories. Files have no children array, while directories always have a children array (which may be empty). The output is formatted with 2-space indentation for readability. Only works within allowed directories.

function.name: filesystem-move_file
function.description: Move or rename files and directories. Can move files between directories and rename them in a single operation. If the destination exists, the operation will fail. Works across different directories and can be used for simple renaming within the same directory. Both source and destination must be within allowed directories.

function.name: filesystem-search_files
function.description: Recursively search for files and directories matching a pattern. Searches through all subdirectories from the starting path. The search is case-insensitive and matches partial names. Returns full paths to all matching items. Great for finding files when you don't know their exact location. Only searches within allowed directories.

function.name: filesystem-get_file_info
function.description: Retrieve detailed metadata about a file or directory. Returns comprehensive information including size, creation time, last modified time, permissions, and type. This tool is perfect for understanding file characteristics without reading the actual content. Only works within allowed directories.

function.name: filesystem-list_allowed_directories
function.description: Returns the list of directories that this server is allowed to access. Use this to understand which directories are available before trying to access files.

function.name: notion-API-get-user
function.description: Notion | Retrieve a user

function.name: notion-API-get-users
function.description: Notion | List all users

start_cursor.description: If supplied, this endpoint will return a page of results starting after the cursor provided. If not supplied, this endpoint will return the first page of results.

page_size.description: The number of items from the full list desired in the response. Maximum: 100

function.name: notion-API-get-self
function.description: Notion | Retrieve your token's bot user

function.name: notion-API-post-database-query
function.description: Notion | Query a database

filter_properties.description: A list of page property value IDs associated with the database. Use this param to limit the response to a specific page property value or values for pages that meet the `filter` criteria.

filter.description: When supplied, limits which pages are returned based on the [filter conditions](ref:post-database-query-filter).

sorts.description: When supplied, orders the results based on the provided [sort criteria](ref:post-database-query-sort).

start_cursor.description: When supplied, returns a page of results starting after the cursor provided. If not supplied, this endpoint will return the first page of results.

page_size.description: The number of items from the full list desired in the response. Maximum: 100

function.name: notion-API-post-search
function.description: Notion | Search by title

query.description: The text that the API compares page and database titles against.

sort.description: A set of criteria, `direction` and `timestamp` keys, that orders the results. The **only** supported timestamp value is `"last_edited_time"`. Supported `direction` values are `"ascending"` and `"descending"`. If `sort` is not provided, then the most recently edited results are returned first.

direction.description: The direction to sort. Possible values include `ascending` and `descending`.

timestamp.description: The name of the timestamp to sort against. Possible values include `last_edited_time`.

filter.description: A set of criteria, `value` and `property` keys, that limits the results to either only pages or only databases. Possible `value` values are `"page"` or `"database"`. The only supported `property` value is `"object"`.

value.description: The value of the property to filter the results by.  Possible values for object type include `page` or `database`.  **Limitation**: Currently the only filter allowed is `object` which will filter by type of object (either `page` or `database`)

property.description: The name of the property to filter by. Currently the only property you can filter by is the object type.  Possible values include `object`.   Limitation: Currently the only filter allowed is `object` which will filter by type of object (either `page` or `database`)

start_cursor.description: A `cursor` value returned in a previous response that If supplied, limits the response to results starting after the `cursor`. If not supplied, then the first page of results is returned. Refer to [pagination](https://developers.notion.com/reference/intro#pagination) for more details.

page_size.description: The number of items from the full list to include in the response. Maximum: `100`.

start_cursor.description: If supplied, this endpoint will return a page of results starting after the cursor provided. If not supplied, this endpoint will return the first page of results.

page_size.description: The number of items from the full list desired in the response. Maximum: 100

function.name: notion-API-patch-block-children
function.description: Notion | Append block children

block_id.description: Identifier for a [block](ref:block). Also accepts a [page](ref:page) ID.

children.description: Child content to append to a container block as an array of [block objects](ref:block)

after.description: The ID of the existing block that the new block should be appended after.

function.name: notion-API-retrieve-a-block
function.description: Notion | Retrieve a block

function.name: notion-API-update-a-block
function.description: Notion | Update a block

type.description: The [block object `type`](ref:block#block-object-keys) value with the properties to be updated. Currently only `text` (for supported block types) and `checked` (for `to_do` blocks) fields can be updated.

archived.description: Set to true to archive (delete) a block. Set to false to un-archive (restore) a block.

function.name: notion-API-delete-a-block
function.description: Notion | Delete a block

function.name: notion-API-retrieve-a-page
function.description: Notion | Retrieve a page

filter_properties.description: A list of page property value IDs associated with the page. Use this param to limit the response to a specific page property value or values. To retrieve multiple properties, specify each page property ID. For example: `?filter_properties=iAk8&filter_properties=b7dh`.

function.name: notion-API-patch-page
function.description: Notion | Update page properties

page_id.description: The identifier for the Notion page to be updated.

properties.description: The property values to update for the page. The keys are the names or IDs of the property and the values are property values. If a page property ID is not included, then it is not changed.

in_trash.description: Set to true to delete a block. Set to false to restore a block.

icon.description: A page icon for the page. Supported types are [external file object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/file-object) or [emoji object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/emoji-object).

cover.description: A cover image for the page. Only [external file objects](https://developers.notion.com/reference/file-object) are supported.

children.description: The content to be rendered on the new page, represented as an array of [block objects](https://developers.notion.com/reference/block).

icon.description: The icon of the new page. Either an [emoji object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/emoji-object) or an [external file object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/file-object)..

cover.description: The cover image of the new page, represented as a [file object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/file-object).

description.description: An array of [rich text objects](https://developers.notion.com/reference/rich-text) that represents the description of the database that is displayed in the Notion UI. If omitted, then the database description remains unchanged.

function.name: terminal-run_command
function.description:
Allows command (CLI) execution in the directory: /workspace/dumps/workspace

Available commands: touch, mkdir, grep, head, chmod, env, more, ps, cp, wc, which, gunzip, tar, nslookup, history, awk, ping, helm, python, tree, cut, du, df, md5sum, traceroute, pwd, sed, mv, tail, ls, dirname, diff, cd, stat, realpath, wget, netstat, file, tr, curl, uniq, ifconfig, git, basename, unzip, less, rm, find, gzip, cat, clear, zip, whoami, echo, hostname, kubectl, sha256sum, sort, date
Available flags: all flags

Shell operators (&&, ||, |, >, >>, <, <<, ;) are supported. Set ALLOW_SHELL_OPERATORS=true to enable.

command.description: Single command to execute (example: 'ls -l' or 'cat file.txt')

function.name: terminal-show_security_rules
function.description: Show what commands and operations are allowed in this environment.

function.name: yahoo-finance-get_historical_stock_prices
function.description:
Get historical stock prices for a given ticker symbol from yahoo finance. Include the following information: Date, Open, High, Low, Close, Volume, Adj Close.
Args:
    ticker: str
        The ticker symbol of the stock to get historical prices for, e.g. "AAPL"
    period : str
        Valid periods: 1d,5d,1mo,3mo,6mo,1y,2y,5y,10y,ytd,max
        Either Use period parameter or use start and end
        Default is "1mo"
    interval : str
        Valid intervals: 1m,2m,5m,15m,30m,60m,90m,1h,1d,5d,1wk,1mo,3mo
        Intraday data cannot extend last 60 days
        Default is "1d"

function.name: yahoo-finance-get_stock_price_by_date
function.description:
Get stock price for a specific date. This tool is more efficient than getting historical prices when you only need data for one specific date.

Args:
    ticker: str
        The ticker symbol of the stock to get price for, e.g. "AAPL"
    date: str
        The specific date to get price for (format: 'YYYY-MM-DD'), e.g. "2024-01-15"
    find_nearest: bool
        If True and the exact date has no trading data (weekend/holiday), return the nearest trading day data.
        If False, return error for non-trading days. Default is True.

function.name: yahoo-finance-get_stock_info
function.description:
Get stock information for a given ticker symbol from yahoo finance. Include the following information:
Stock Price & Trading Info, Company Information, Financial Metrics, Earnings & Revenue, Margins & Returns, Dividends, Balance Sheet, Ownership, Analyst Coverage, Risk Metrics, Other.

Args:
    ticker: str
        The ticker symbol of the stock to get information for, e.g. "AAPL"

function.name: yahoo-finance-get_yahoo_finance_news
function.description:
Get news for a given ticker symbol from yahoo finance.

Args:
    ticker: str
        The ticker symbol of the stock to get news for, e.g. "AAPL"

function.name: yahoo-finance-get_stock_actions
function.description:
Get stock dividends and stock splits for a given ticker symbol from yahoo finance.

Args:
    ticker: str
        The ticker symbol of the stock to get stock actions for, e.g. "AAPL"

function.name: yahoo-finance-get_financial_statement
function.description:
Get financial statement for a given ticker symbol from yahoo finance. You can choose from the following financial statement types: income_stmt, quarterly_income_stmt, balance_sheet, quarterly_balance_sheet, cashflow, quarterly_cashflow.

Args:
    ticker: str
        The ticker symbol of the stock to get financial statement for, e.g. "AAPL"
    financial_type: str
        The type of financial statement to get. You can choose from the following financial statement types: income_stmt, quarterly_income_stmt, balance_sheet, quarterly_balance_sheet, cashflow, quarterly_cashflow.

function.name: yahoo-finance-get_holder_info
function.description:
Get holder information for a given ticker symbol from yahoo finance. You can choose from the following holder types: major_holders, institutional_holders, mutualfund_holders, insider_transactions, insider_purchases, insider_roster_holders.

Args:
    ticker: str
        The ticker symbol of the stock to get holder information for, e.g. "AAPL"
    holder_type: str
        The type of holder information to get. You can choose from the following holder types: major_holders, institutional_holders, mutualfund_holders, insider_transactions, insider_purchases, insider_roster_holders.

function.name: yahoo-finance-get_option_expiration_dates
function.description:
Fetch the available options expiration dates for a given ticker symbol.

Args:
    ticker: str
        The ticker symbol of the stock to get option expiration dates for, e.g. "AAPL"

function.name: yahoo-finance-get_option_chain
function.description:
Fetch the option chain for a given ticker symbol, expiration date, and option type.

Args:
    ticker: str
        The ticker symbol of the stock to get option chain for, e.g. "AAPL"
    expiration_date: str
        The expiration date for the options chain (format: 'YYYY-MM-DD')
    option_type: str
        The type of option to fetch ('calls' or 'puts')

function.name: yahoo-finance-get_recommendations
function.description:
Get recommendations or upgrades/downgrades for a given ticker symbol from yahoo finance. You can also specify the number of months back to get upgrades/downgrades for, default is 12.

Args:
    ticker: str
        The ticker symbol of the stock to get recommendations for, e.g. "AAPL"
    recommendation_type: str
        The type of recommendation to get. You can choose from the following recommendation types: recommendations, upgrades_downgrades.
    months_back: int
        The number of months back to get upgrades/downgrades for, default is 12.

function.name: local-claim_done
function.description: claim the task is done

function.name: local-python-execute
function.description: Execute Python code directly under the agent workspace, and returns stdout, stderr, return code, and execution time in a structured format.

code.description: Python code to execute (can be directly pasted into a .py file)

filename.description: Filename for the Python file (including .py extension). If not provided, a random UUID will be used.

timeout.description: Maximum execution time in seconds. Cannot exceed 120 seconds. If a value greater than 120 is provided, it will be automatically limited to 120 seconds. Default is 30 seconds.

function.name: local-search_overlong_tooloutput
function.description: Search within overlong tool output content using regex patterns and return first page with session ID

shortuuid.description: The shortuuid identifier for the overlong tool output

pattern.description: The regex pattern to search for in the content

page_size.description: Number of matches per page (default: 10, max: 50)

context_size.description: Characters of context around each match (default: 1000)

function.name: local-search_overlong_tooloutput_navigate
function.description: Navigate through search results using search session ID

search_session_id.description: The search session ID returned from search_overlong_tool

target_page.description: Target page number (required for jump_to_page action)

function.name: local-view_overlong_tooloutput
function.description: View overlong tool output content with pagination and return first page with session ID

shortuuid.description: The shortuuid identifier for the overlong tool output

page_size.description: Number of characters per page (default: 10000, max: 100000)

function.name: local-view_overlong_tooloutput_navigate
function.description: Navigate through view content using view session ID

view_session_id.description: The view session ID returned from view_overlong_tool

target_page.description: Target page number (required for jump_to_page action)

function.name: local-check_context_status
function.description: Query current conversation context status, including turn statistics, token usage, truncation history and other information

function.name: local-manage_context
function.description:
Manage conversation context by deleting historical messages to free up space. Supports multiple strategies:
- keep_recent_turns: Keep the most recent N turns of conversation
- keep_recent_percent: Keep the most recent X% of conversation  
- delete_first_turns: Delete the earliest N turns of conversation
- delete_first_percent: Delete the earliest X% of conversation

action.description: Operation to execute, currently only supports truncate

value.description: Numeric parameter, for turns methods it's number of turns, for percent methods it's percentage (0-100)

function.name: local-smart_context_truncate
function.description:
Smart context truncation tool that precisely controls retained content by specifying ranges.
Accepts 2D list [[start1,end1],[start2,end2],...,[startN,endN]], each sublist represents a closed range to retain (both ends included).
Indexing starts from 0, ranges cannot overlap, must be arranged in order.

ranges.description: List of ranges to retain, format: [[start1,end1],[start2,end2],...], indexing starts from 0

function.name: local-search_history
function.description: Search history conversation records. Support multiple keyword search or regular expression search, return records containing all keywords. Support paging to browse all results.

keywords.description: Search keyword list or regular expression list, will find records matching all patterns

use_regex.description: Whether to treat keywords as regular expressions

function.name: local-view_history_turn
function.description: View the complete conversation content of a specific turn, including the context of previous and subsequent turns. Support content truncation to view long content.

context_turns.description: Display the context of previous and subsequent turns

truncate.description: Whether to truncate long content (keep the first 500 and last 500 characters)

function.name: local-browse_history
function.description: Browse history records in chronological order, support forward or backward browsing. Can choose whether to truncate long content.

direction.description: Browse direction: forward from early to late, backward from late to early

truncate.description: Whether to truncate long content display

function.name: local-history_stats
function.description: Get statistics of history records, including total turns, time range, message type distribution, etc.

function.name: local-search_in_turn
function.description: Search content within a specific turn, support regular expressions. Used to find specific information in long content (such as tool output).

jump_to.description: Jump to: 'first'(first page), 'last'(last page), 'next'(next page), 'prev'(previous page), or specific page number

messages.content:
I have prepared two data tables in the Notion `Oil Price` page. Please fetch WTI and Brent monthly prices for the last 12 months from Yahoo Finance, analyze the WTI-Brent oil spread changes and calculate related indicators, implement a z-score-based spread trading strategy backtest, and return a summary report.

For detailed technical specifications, please refer to the `detail.md` file.
{"type":"text","text":"Error: Access denied - path outside allowed directories: /workspace not in /workspace/dumps/workspace","annotations":null}

{"type":"text","text":"- **Data**: Fetch monthly data for WTI (CL=F) and Brent (BZ=F) from Yahoo Finance for the last 12 complete calendar months. Prices should be rounded to 4 decimal places, percentages to 2 decimal places.
- **Calculations**:

  | Indicator        | Description                                                                                                                                |
  | ---------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
  | Brent-WTI Spread | Brent Close - WTI Close                                                                                                                    |
  | MoM%             | (Current Month / Previous Month - 1) × 100%                                                                                                |
  | Z-Score(6m)      | Standardized using mean and SAMPLE standard deviation (ddof=1) of the last 6 spreads (z=0 when sample < 4 or std = 0, clipped to [-3,3]).  |

- **Backtest Strategy**: Generate signals based on z-score (z ≤ -1: long spread = long Brent + short WTI; z ≥ +1: short spread = short Brent + long WTI; otherwise flat). Signals generated at month-end, held for 1 month, closed at next month-end. Only one position at a time; equal weight for both legs; 0.40% round-trip cost included in monthly net returns. Calculate total return, annualized return, Sharpe ratio, win rate, and maximum drawdown.

  - **Tip:** Entry Month refers to signal generation month, Exit Month refers to position closing month. Position returns are calculated from signal generation month to position closing month (spanning 2 calendar months)

- **Write results to** **`Oil Market Summary`** **Oil Market Summary** and **`Spread Strategy Backtest`** **Spread Strategy Backtest** data tables. For `Spread Strategy Backtest`, update the unique "Metric" row and add/update corresponding "Trade" rows for each executed trade:

  - When Type=Metric: fill in `Period Start`, `Period End`, `Trades`, `Total Return %`, `Annualized Return %`, `Sharpe (ann.)`, `Win Rate %`, `Max Drawdown %`, `Cost Assumption`;
  - When Type=Trade: fill in `Entry Month`, `Exit Month`, `Signal`, `Entry Spread`, `Exit Spread`, `Leg Returns %`, `Net PnL %`, `Notes`.
","annotations":null}

function.name: local-python-execute
function.arguments:
{"filename":"oil_market_analysis.py","code":"
import pandas as pd

wti_data = [{"Date":"2024-10-01T04:00:00.000Z","Open":68.4100036621,"High":78.4599990845,"Low":66.3300018311,"Close":69.2600021362,"Volume":7647098,"Dividends":0.0,"Stock Splits":0.0},{"Date":"2024-11-01T04:00:00.000Z","Open":70.4400024414,"High":72.8799972534,"Low":66.6100006104,"Close":68.0,"Volume":5980019,"Dividends":0.0,"Stock Splits":0.0},{"Date":"2025-01-01T05:00:00.000Z","Open":71.8499984741,"High":80.7699966431,"Low":71.7900009155,"Close":72.5299987793,"Volume":6940780,"Dividends":0.0,"Stock Splits":0.0},{"Date":"2025-02-01T05:00:00.000Z","Open":74.1399993896,"High":75.1800003052,"Low":68.3600006104,"Close":69.7600021362,"Volume":5320902,"Dividends":0.0,"Stock Splits":0.0},{"Date":"2025-03-01T05:00:00.000Z","Open":69.9499969482,"High":71.8300018311,"Low":65.2200012207,"Close":71.4800033569,"Volume":5307703,"Dividends":0.0,"Stock Splits":0.0},{"Date":"2025-04-01T04:00:00.000Z","Open":71.3899993896,"High":72.2799987793,"Low":55.1199989319,"Close":58.2099990845,"Volume":7119077,"Dividends":0.0,"Stock Splits":0.0},{"Date":"2025-05-01T04:00:00.000Z","Open":58.1599998474,"High":64.1900024414,"Low":55.2999992371,"Close":60.7900009155,"Volume":5761820,"Dividends":0.0,"Stock Splits":0.0},{"Date":"2025-07-01T04:00:00.000Z","Open":64.9599990845,"High":70.5100021362,"Low":64.6699981689,"Close":69.2600021362,"Volume":5083485,"Dividends":0.0,"Stock Splits":0.0},{"Date":"2025-08-01T04:00:00.000Z","Open":69.3499984741,"High":69.5800018311,"Low":61.9399986267,"Close":64.0100021362,"Volume":4912110,"Dividends":0.0,"Stock Splits":0.0},{"Date":"2025-09-01T04:00:00.000Z","Open":63.9500007629,"High":66.0299987793,"Low":61.4500007629,"Close":62.4000015259,"Volume":3289481,"Dividends":0.0,"Stock Splits":0.0}]
brent_data = [{"Date":"2024-10-01T04:00:00.000Z","Open":72.0,"High":82.0800018311,"Low":69.9100036621,"Close":73.1600036621,"Volume":952900,"Dividends":0.0,"Stock Splits":0.0},{"Date":"2024-11-01T04:00:00.000Z","Open":74.1299972534,"High":76.2300033569,"Low":70.6999969482,"Close":72.9400024414,"Volume":684173,"Dividends":0.0,"Stock Splits":0.0},{"Date":"2025-01-01T05:00:00.000Z","Open":74.8799972534,"High":82.6299972534,"Low":74.7300033569,"Close":76.7600021362,"Volume":1055033,"Dividends":0.0,"Stock Splits":0.0},{"Date":"2025-02-01T05:00:00.000Z","Open":76.8199996948,"High":77.5299987793,"Low":72.3899993896,"Close":73.1800003052,"Volume":714183,"Dividends":0.0,"Stock Splits":0.0},{"Date":"2025-03-01T05:00:00.000Z","Open":73.0699996948,"High":74.7900009155,"Low":68.3399963379,"Close":74.7399978638,"Volume":726527,"Dividends":0.0,"Stock Splits":0.0},{"Date":"2025-04-01T04:00:00.000Z","Open":74.6299972534,"High":75.4599990845,"Low":58.3899993896,"Close":63.1199989319,"Volume":1306864,"Dividends":0.0,"Stock Splits":0.0},{"Date":"2025-05-01T04:00:00.000Z","Open":61.1399993896,"High":67.4899978638,"Low":58.4099998474,"Close":63.9000015259,"Volume":1032061,"Dividends":0.0,"Stock Splits":0.0},{"Date":"2025-07-01T04:00:00.000Z","Open":66.5899963379,"High":73.6299972534,"Low":66.3399963379,"Close":72.5299987793,"Volume":903089,"Dividends":0.0,"Stock Splits":0.0},{"Date":"2025-08-01T04:00:00.000Z","Open":71.7699966431,"High":71.9899978638,"Low":65.0,"Close":68.1200027466,"Volume":721891,"Dividends":0.0,"Stock Splits":0.0},{"Date":"2025-09-01T04:00:00.000Z","Open":67.4300003052,"High":69.5100021362,"Low":65.0800018311,"Close":66.6800003052,"Volume":555800,"Dividends":0.0,"Stock Splits":0.0}]

wti_df = pd.DataFrame(wti_data)
brent_df = pd.DataFrame(brent_data)

wti_df['Date'] = pd.to_datetime(wti_df['Date'])
brent_df['Date'] = pd.to_datetime(brent_df['Date'])

wti_df = wti_df.rename(columns={'Close': 'WTI_Close'})
brent_df = brent_df.rename(columns={'Close': 'Brent_Close'})

df = pd.merge(wti_df[['Date', 'WTI_Close']], brent_df[['Date', 'Brent_Close']], on='Date')

df['Brent-WTI Spread'] = df['Brent_Close'] - df['WTI_Close']
df['WTI_MoM%'] = (df['WTI_Close'].pct_change() * 100).round(2)
df['Brent_MoM%'] = (df['Brent_Close'].pct_change() * 100).round(2)


def calculate_z_score(series):
    if len(series) < 4:
        return 0
    mean = series.mean()
    std = series.std(ddof=1)
    if std == 0:
        return 0
    z_score = (series.iloc[-1] - mean) / std
    return max(min(z_score, 3), -3)

df['Z-Score(6m)'] = df['Brent-WTI Spread'].rolling(window=6).apply(calculate_z_score, raw=False)


def backtest(df):
    df['Signal'] = 0
    df.loc[df['Z-Score(6m)'] <= -1, 'Signal'] = 1
    df.loc[df['Z-Score(6m)'] >= 1, 'Signal'] = -1

    df['Position'] = df['Signal'].shift(1)
    df['Position'].fillna(0, inplace=True)

    df['Brent_Return'] = df['Brent_Close'].pct_change()
    df['WTI_Return'] = df['WTI_Close'].pct_change()

    df['Strategy_Return'] = 0.0
    df.loc[df['Position'] == 1, 'Strategy_Return'] = df['Brent_Return'] - df['WTI_Return']
    df.loc[df['Position'] == -1, 'Strategy_Return'] = df['WTI_Return'] - df['Brent_Return']

    cost = 0.0040
    df['Trade_Cost'] = 0
    df.loc[df['Position'] != df['Position'].shift(1), 'Trade_Cost'] = cost

    df['Net_Return'] = df['Strategy_Return'] - df['Trade_Cost']

    total_return = (1 + df['Net_Return']).prod() - 1
    annualized_return = (1 + total_return)**(12 / len(df)) - 1
    annualized_volatility = df['Net_Return'].std() * (12**0.5)
    sharpe_ratio = annualized_return / annualized_volatility if annualized_volatility != 0 else 0
    
    trades = df[df['Position'] != 0]
    win_rate = (trades['Net_Return'] > 0).sum() / len(trades) if len(trades) > 0 else 0

    cumulative_return = (1 + df['Net_Return']).cumprod()
    peak = cumulative_return.expanding(min_periods=1).max()
    drawdown = (cumulative_return - peak) / peak
    max_drawdown = drawdown.min()
    
    backtest_results = {
        "total_return": total_return,
        "annualized_return": annualized_return,
        "sharpe_ratio": sharpe_ratio,
        "win_rate": win_rate,
        "max_drawdown": max_drawdown,
        "trades": len(trades)
    }

    return backtest_results, df

backtest_metrics, backtest_df = backtest(df.copy())

print("--- Oil Market Summary ---")
print(df.round(4).to_string())

print("\n--- Spread Strategy Backtest ---")
print(backtest_df.round(4).to_string())

print("\n--- Backtest Metrics ---")
print(backtest_metrics)
"}
